Articles.Content:
What if there is a parallel universe where the Kerbals are real and they have human space program, launch from earth.

Have a version of these forums but instead of us writing about them and their rocketry, they write about us...
Poor Kerbals. It would be so much more difficult with those bigger planets and moons, the larger distances etc. "Great, Neill missed the moon. Again."

It's certainly food for thought, i've often wondered if other civilizations may have existed trillions of years in the past or will exist trillions of years in the future, i keep forgetting that in a universe this large time is as big a barrier to meeting other creatures as distance.

For the sake of kerbal-kind i hope they never find a wormhole to our dimension, it wouldn't take long for us to stop patting them on the head and start opening them up to see how their organs work.
If I had access to a Kerbal, I would use him/her as a hat stand, feed them sunbeams and be nice to them

[...] start opening them up to see how their organs work.

Hrhr...

I think that kerbals are much more intelligent than the majority of the human race

"Human Space Program, a game about silly (my bad, thanks for pointing that out llamatoes ) giants

Being primitive beings, their interests include killing eachother, Reproducing and competing for social status.

Your job as a Kerbal, is to pull "Earths" pathetic space program together and show them that there is a much bigger universe out there to explore

You must do this preferably before they do something stupid and kill themselves off."

Edited April 23, 2013 by zpox357

'Pink' people?

Please try to be more PC

By the multiverse theory, there would indeed be a universe inhabited by little green kerbals eager to shoot to the stars in explosive fashion. I can't imagine how such beings survived so long in the evolutionary line, but they did.

in another universe, I'm captain Malcom Reynolds and I'm dating Emma Watson.
There are going to be tests soon apparently to find out whether our universe is a computer simulation, don't ask me how but they're testing it lol
What if we are Sims, and I might go upstairs THE TOILET MAY BE DELETED

Suggestion: How can you do anything with these unrealistically underpowered Ion engines? rebalance please
Bug Report: The gravity of the celestial bodies seem to be extending beyond the SoI of that body.
Don't you think halting all flights of a given design for a year or two just because of one failure is a little harsh?
SSTO spaceplanes are the hardest thing to get right in this game.
President Kerman sucks! Bring back President Kerman!

-- User banned by mod Kerman

So in some ways, not that different.

Hrhr...

Aside: since this image is from XCOM: UFO Defense... The Armory music in Tron: Legacy sounds a lot like it was from this game.

What if there is a parallel universe where the Kerbals are real and they have human space program, launch from earth.

Have a version of these forums but instead of us writing about them and their rocketry, they write about us...

Late at night, while in the middle of munar transfer, I stopped time warp and looked inside the capsule. Jeb was playing The Sims and giggling. One of his sims was playing KSP and giggling. One of those Kerbals was playing Human Space Program, and giggling. I got too scared to look any further, so I turned off my computer, which immediately disappeared. And that's why I don't have my homework.

Edited April 23, 2013 by Zephram Kerman

Late at night, while in the middle of munar transfer, I stopped time warp and looked inside the capsule. Jeb was playing The Sims and giggling. One of his sims was playing KSP and giggling. One of those Kerbals was playing Human Space Program, and giggling. I got too scared to look any further, so I turned off my computer, which immediately disappeared. And that's why I don't have my homework.

I wish I'd get an Euro every time that I hear this from my students...

If I had access to a Kerbal, I would use him/her as a hat stand, feed them sunbeams and be nice to them

I'd keep mine as a pet. And never let it get interested in rocketry, otherwise we might have a Jebidiah 2.0

I'd keep mine as a pet. And never let it get interested in rocketry, otherwise we might have a Jebidiah 2.0

I would let it learn how to cook digestive biscuits, and I would feed it BREADFISH, WHICH WILL RESULT IN YOUR DEATH MWAHAHAHAH

MWAHAHAHAHMWAHAHAHAHAHA
